result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[ma] Cases 20CT469, 21CF132, 21CF326,21CF543,22CF21,22CF144,22CF162 called at 10:46 AM 
Defendant Taylor J. Peterson in court.  Attorney Karl E Huebner in court for Taylor J. Peterson.  Attorney Theresa A Beck in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Waiver of Preliminary Hearing and Arraignment occur in Case 21CF543: 
Mr. Peterson waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived

ADA Beck alerts Court that special prosecution on case of Mr. Peterson that is being handled out of county due to recusal, has requested certain conditions be included in this settlement; the Court will not order/take action on this request, as this Court previously recused from said case[21CM199].

Maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed.
Plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on Count #1 of Case 20CT469
Plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on Counts #2, #3, #4, and #5 of Case 22CF144
Plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on Counts #1, #4 and #5 of Case 22CF162
Plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on Counts #1 and #4 of Case 21CF326
Plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on Count #1 of Case 21CF543
Factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance is verified.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses: Remaining Counts of 22CF144,22CF162,21CF326,21CF543,21CF132,22CF21.

Sentencing recommendations/ arguments given by Counsel 
Statement made by Mr. Peterson 

On Count #1 of Case 20CT469, the Court sentences Defendant to pay a fine of $25 plus costs= $484.50..  The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office.  Non-payment results in 9 days in jail with Huber-release privileges, consecutive.
The Court does not order any drivers license revocation.
3 demerit points assessed
The Court requires the Defendant to comply with DNA sample provision.


On Counts #2, #3, #4, and #5 of Case 22CF144, the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 3 years.
On Counts #1, #4 and #5 of Case 22CF162, the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 3 years.
On Counts #1 and #4 of Case 21CF326, the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 3 years.
On Count #1 of Case 21CF543, the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years.

Conditions of Probation: 
--On Count #4 of Case 22CF144: to serve 30 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence on 11/2/22 at 6:00pm
---Mr. Peterson is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--complete Batterers Intervention programming, certified is preferred
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--take any and all prescription medications only as prescribed by treating physician
--no contact with any know drug offender except for treatment or as deemed appropriate per Agent
--no possession of any dangerous weapons
--no possession or use of any drug paraphernalia 
--if permitted to travel out of State, no possession or use of marijuana(THC) in states where it is legal. No legal CBD products or other legal cannabis derivatives without express written permission of agent
--no acts or threats of violence towards any person
--no contact with Victim 1 in 22CF21, without DOC approval and Victim consent
--contact with Victim 1 in 21CF132 and 21CF326 only as approved by DOC and as approved by Victim 1
--to comply with DNA sample provision 

As to Case 22CF144: Separate from the conditions of Probation, the Court orders payment of costs, fees and surcharges through the Clerk of Courts Office. [Clerk calculates this total to be:$1922] The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to either pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office.  Non-payment will result in 38  days in Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive.  

As to Case 21CF543: Separate from the conditions of Probation, the Court orders payment of costs, fees and surcharges through the Clerk of Courts Office. [Clerk calculates this total to be:$518] The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to either pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office.  Non-payment will result in 10  days in Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive.  

As to Case 21CF326: Separate from the conditions of Probation, the Court orders payment of costs, fees and surcharges through the Clerk of Courts Office. [Clerk calculates this total to be:$961] The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to either pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office.  Non-payment will result in 19  days in Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive.  

As to Case 22CF162: Separate from the conditions of Probation, the Court orders payment of costs, fees and surcharges through the Clerk of Courts Office. [Clerk calculates this total to be:$1554] The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to either pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office.  Non-payment will result in 30  days in Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive.  

Parties will submit a stipulation as to days credit. 
recess: 11:42am
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Taylor J Peterson appears in court with Attorney Karl Huebner. ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Parson verifies Victim Rights Compliance.

Att Huebner states that a global resolution has been reached, and requests that a Plea and Sentencing hearing be scheduled sometime. The State requests that it be scheduled in approximately three weeks.

The Court states that it will conduct the Waiver of Preliminary Hearing in file 21CF543 at the next scheduled hearing.

Defendant Taylor J. Peterson in court with Attorney Karl Huebner. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Huebner indicates that the Defense is withdrawing the speedy trial request in Case #22CF162, indicating that the parties are exploring a treatment court option 
The Court removes the Case #22CF162 Jury Trial date next week. 
Attorney Huebner indicates that the Defense is prepared to proceed to plea and sentencing in Case #20CT469 today, however after Mr. Peterson comments that he is very tired and his mind is a bit foggy, the Court does not proceed. 
recess 11:50am

Letter from Att Huebner RE Billable hours

Attorney Huebner

[MK] cases #20CT469, #21CF132, #21CF326, #21CF543, #22CF21 called at 10:05am 
Defendant Taylor J. Peterson in court, in custody, with Attorney Teri Strohschein. ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Both counsel acknowledge receipt of the competency examination report of Dr. Elliott filed on March 18th. ADA Beck indicates that the State is in agreement with the report outcome. Attorney Strohschein indicates the Defense is not objecting to the finding of competency to stand trial. 
Mr. Peterson verifies that he understands he has the right to make a presentation regarding his competency. He confirms that he is not challenging the finding of competency.
The Court finds Mr. Peterson is competent to proceed.

Attorney Strohschein orally Motions to Withdraw as Counsel due to her new position.  
The Court grants the Motion to Withdraw. The Court directs that successor counsel is to be appointed. 
The Court addresses with Mr. Peterson concern that it indicates in the report that he told Dr. Elliot that he plans to fire the next attorney and start the process over. Thereafter Mr. Peterson indicates it depends on the attorney's competency and their willingness to perform their duties.  The Court indicates to Mr. Peterson that he is entitled to competent representation. Mr. Peterson needs to cooperate with counsel.  The Court will not tolerate dilatory tactics; he is expected to work with his new attorney. If he cannot do so, then this may result in the attorney serving as standby counsel and Mr. Peterson will be trying his cases on his own.  
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance; a victim is present.
Mr. Peterson requests that the Court modify Bond so that he has some ability to contact the victim.
ADA Beck voices objection to the request.
The Court denies Mr. Peterson's request to modify Bond.    
recess 10:12am.  
[Post Hearing:  in response to the clerk's inquiries, the Court indicates that even though Case #22CF144 was not called by the Court at the hearing, the Court is taking similar action in the case--counsel is to be appointed for Mr. Peterson on that case also.   The Court continues to toll time limits in Cases #22CF21 and #22CF144.]

NEXT:  (1) Attorney Strohschein has been discharged as counsel; successor counsel is to be appointed in the five cases called today, and appointment of counsel is also needed in Case #22CF144,  (2) Status Conference in Cases #20CT469, #21CF132, #21CF326, #21CF543, and Adjourned Initial Appearances in Cases #22CF21 and #22CF144--all on June 3rd at 3:00pm [JA- note in comments for cases #21CF543 that the case is at prelim stage]

[ma] Cases 20CT469, 21CF132, 21CF326, 21CF543, 22CF21 called at 8:22am
Defendant Taylor J. Peterson in court with Attorney Teri Strohschein.   ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Parson verifies victim right compliance.

The Court reviews court records.

Atty Strohschein raises competency across all files to include 21CM199 (which has been transferred to Dodge Co).

Victim of Cases 21CF132 and 21CF326 addresses Court re: no contact order.

The Court denies Victim's request for contact.

The Court finds probable cause on each of the complaints; the Court orders Mr. Peterson to submit to an examination to determine his competency to proceed, to be conducted by DHS.

The Court directs Atty Strohschein to contact Dodge Co about Case 21CM199.

Atty Strohschein will submit proposed orders.

[ml] Case called at 1:40PM
Defendant Taylor J. Peterson appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD appears for bond-purposes only; Def not eligible).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient by counsel agreement. 

The Court appoints attorney Teri Strohschein to this file as the Defendant already has open files where she is appointed. Att De La Rosa appears for this hearing for bond purposes only.

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court tolls any pending time limits and preserves the Defendant's jurisdictional and constitutional objections and sets this matter over for an Adjourned Initial Appearance.

The Court requires a $500.00 Cash Bond with conditions:
--no contact with Victim 1
--not possess any dangerous weapons
